summary: This document is an email from Elise Visok describing her last contact with Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. She reports on his mental state, requests, and planned meeting with attorneys shortly before his death.

persons.name: Elise Visok
persons.context: Author of the email describing her visit with inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU. She appears to be a staff member (possibly a counselor or administrator) who visited him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate visited by Elise Visok in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He is described as making various requests, denying suicidal thoughts, and planning to meet with his attorneys.

connections.description: Visok visited Epstein in the SHU to check on him and report on his condition and requests.
Epstein was planning to meet with his attorneys to work on his legal situation.
Epstein had a cell mate in the SHU with whom Visok saw him interact.

events.title: Last Contact Visit with Epstein
events.description: Elise Visok visited Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He denied suicidal thoughts, made various requests (social calls without speaker phone, retrieval of a book), and planned to meet with his attorneys.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at Metropolitan Correctional Center
keyFacts: Elise Visok visited Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU on Thursday, August 8, 2019, shortly before his death.
Epstein denied any suicidal thoughts or intentions and showed no signs of depression or anxiety during the visit.
Epstein made specific requests including social calls without a speaker phone and retrieval of a book left in the suicide watch area.
Epstein had a cell mate in the SHU and was planning to meet with his attorneys to work on his legal situation.
